mdRecord.dcterms:title: Group on east lawn at Mount Vernon, c. 1895-1904
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington Souvenir Co., Publishers
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Mounted black and white photograph of group posing near the east front of the Mansion, c. 1895-1904. A label adhered to the reverse of the mount denotes the photograph was taken by The Washington Souvenir Co., 1333 Penna., Ave., Washington, D. C. A handwritten note on the reverse by Francis R. and Elizabeth Ritchie Taylor reads: We were at Washington on the 15th, 16th and 17th of the fourth ms.__and this photo was taken on the 15th at Mount Vernon. Albert Votaw [famous Quaker] and his wife chaperoned our party. He is sitting the second row on extreme left. Also present but unidentified are Francis R. and Elizabeth Ritchie Taylor of Cheltenham, PA.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
